conclusion: Analyze how shadows A, B, C, and D change when light source moves to front right and farther away.
Object near A is a cylindrical/mechanical object with white and black parts.
Object near B is a small dark object, appears to be some kind of fragment.
Shadow C appears to be the shadow of the cylindrical object.
Object near D is a small white paper airplane or folded paper.
General principles of shadow behavior: shadows shift opposite to light movement, become longer when light is lower/farther, and become less defined when light is farther.
Shadow A position change: moves to back left when light moves to front right.
Shadow A size change: becomes larger (longer) as light moves farther away.
Shadow A shape change: becomes slightly more diffuse and less sharp.
Shadow B position change: moves to back left, opposite to light's movement.
Shadow B size change: elongates as light source moves farther away.
Shadow B shape change: becomes slightly more diffuse.
Shadow C position change: moves to back left.
Shadow C size change: becomes longer and potentially merges more with shadow A.
Shadow C shape change: becomes more elongated and slightly less defined.
Shadow D position change: moves to back left, opposite to light's movement.
Shadow D size change: becomes longer as light source moves away.
Shadow D shape change: triangular shadow elongates and may become slightly distorted.
Final answer: All shadows shift to back left, increase in size, become more diffuse, and proportions may change slightly.
